author: S Prasad
text:
Govt. handed over allotment letters for the project to Jipmer administration

The government on Tuesday issued land allotment letters to Jipmer administration for establishing the off-site medical college of Jipmer in Karaikal.

The letters were handed over on Wednesday by Director of Health K.V. Raman to Dr. S.C. Parija, Director of Jipmer. It was done in the presence of Chief Minister N. Rangasamy in the Legislative Assembly.

Mr. Rangasamy said that the government was aware of the request from the people of Karaikal for super specialty medical services.

The governing council of Jipmer gave its approval for starting the college-cum-hospital. Health care facilities in Karaikal would now get a fillip. Medical education at the college in particular would greatly benefit students in Karaikal, he said.

The government had acquired 79.91 acres of land in Karaikal and the construction would begin soon. Jipmer branch would begin functioning at a nursing college in Karaikal temporarily until the construction of new buildings was completed, Mr. Rangasamy said.

Mr. Parija said that the medical college would start functioning in temporary buildings with an intake of 50 students from the current academic year. The students’ strength would be increased to 100 on completion of permanent buildings.

A sum of Rs. 384 crore had been proposed for establishing buildings and other infrastructure in the first phase. The proposal would be sent to the Standing Committee on Finance and on getting its approval construction would commence.
title: Decks cleared for off-site medical college of Jipmer in Karaikal
